compactedSummary: Project uses bun + Fastify (port 4000, ES2022). DB: Drizzle + Neon PostgreSQL, UUID PKs, snake_case tables. Auth: iron-session (7d, arclight_session cookie) — migrated from JWT week 4. Email: SendGrid (SENDGRID_API_KEY) — switched from Resend week 4. Cache: ioredis (src/lib/redis.ts), key format arclight:{entity}:{id}, TTL 600s. Jobs: BullMQ on Redis. Tests: vitest, 80% coverage target. CI: GitHub Actions. Logging: Pino, LOG_LEVEL env, default info.

answers.answer: Based on the project summary and memory search: Port 4000. The PORT env var defaults to 4000, chosen to avoi... (simplified)
Port 4000. The PORT env var defaults to 4000, chosen to avoid conflict with Vite's default port 3000.
Based on the project summary and memory search: 600 seconds (10 minutes). This is the default TTL for cache ... (simplified)
600 seconds (10 minutes). This is the default TTL for cache entries using ioredis.
Based on the project summary and memory search: arclight:{entity}:{id} — for example, arclight:user:abc123 o... (simplified)
arclight:{entity}:{id} — for example, arclight:user:abc123 or arclight:team:xyz789. This namespaces all keys under the arclight prefix.
Based on the project summary and memory search: bun. It was chosen for fast installs and built-in TypeScript... (simplified)
bun. It was chosen for fast installs and built-in TypeScript transpilation.
Based on the project summary and memory search: /api/v1 — all endpoints are prefixed with /api/v1.... (simplified)
/api/v1 — all endpoints are prefixed with /api/v1.
Based on the project summary and memory search: ES2022. This is what Bun and Node 18+ support natively, avoi... (simplified)
ES2022. This is what Bun and Node 18+ support natively, avoiding unnecessary downcompilation.
Based on the project summary and memory search: vitest — chosen because it is Vite-compatible, faster than J... (simplified)
vitest — chosen because it is Vite-compatible, faster than Jest, and has native ESM support.
Based on the project summary and memory search: 15 minutes. Presigned PUT URLs expire after 15 minutes.... (simplified)
15 minutes. Presigned PUT URLs expire after 15 minutes.
Based on the project summary and memory search: 100 requests per 15-minute window per IP. Auth endpoints get... (simplified)
100 requests per 15-minute window per IP. Auth endpoints get 1000 per 15-minute window.
Based on the project summary and memory search: 'info'. The log level is set from the LOG_LEVEL env var, def... (simplified)
'info'. The log level is set from the LOG_LEVEL env var, defaulting to 'info'.
Based on the project summary and memory search: kebab-case — for example, user-profile.ts, auth-middleware.t... (simplified)
kebab-case — for example, user-profile.ts, auth-middleware.ts.
Based on the project summary and memory search: max 10 connections. The pg pool for background workers is co... (simplified)
max 10 connections. The pg pool for background workers is configured with { max: 10 }.
Based on the project summary and memory search: src/lib/redis.ts. The ioredis client is created there and ex... (simplified)
src/lib/redis.ts. The ioredis client is created there and exported as a singleton.
Based on the project summary and memory search: Errors must include the operation name: throw new Error(`${o... (simplified)
Errors must include the operation name: throw new Error(`${operation}: ${message}`). For example: throw new Error('createUser: email already exists').
Based on the project summary and memory search: { data, error, meta }. Data is the payload (null on errors).... (simplified)
{ data, error, meta }. Data is the payload (null on errors). Error is { code, message } (null on success). Meta holds pagination info.
Based on the project summary and memory search: Fastify is schema-first with built-in request/response valid... (simplified)

Fastify is schema-first with built-in request/response validation via JSON Schema, giving TypeScript types from the same definition. It is also faster than Express. Express would have required adding a separate validation layer.
Based on the project summary and memory search: Prisma bundles a ~10MB query engine binary that causes probl... (simplified)

Prisma bundles a ~10MB query engine binary that causes problems in serverless environments. Drizzle is ~50KB, ships plain TypeScript, requires no code generation step, and produces more predictable SQL.
Based on the project summary and memory search: JWT tokens were being decoded by frontend JavaScript, exposi... (simplified)

JWT tokens were being decoded by frontend JavaScript, exposing the user data structure (role, teamId, email). HS256 is a signature not encryption — the payload is visible to anyone with the token. iron-session encrypts the session data so the client only ever sees ciphertext.
Based on the project summary and memory search: The compliance team required all third-party vendors to be S... (simplified)
The compliance team required all third-party vendors to be SOC 2 Type 2 certified. Resend does not hold that certification. SendGrid does.
Based on the project summary and memory search: The custom setTimeout-based queue did not support job priori... (simplified)
The custom setTimeout-based queue did not support job priorities, retries with configurable backoff, or failed job retention. Failed jobs were silently disappearing with no visibility.
Based on the project summary and memory search: vitest is Vite-compatible, significantly faster than Jest on... (simplified)
vitest is Vite-compatible, significantly faster than Jest on large codebases, and has native ESM support without extra transform configuration.
Based on the project summary and memory search: Presigned S3 PUT URLs let the client upload directly to S3 w... (simplified)

Presigned S3 PUT URLs let the client upload directly to S3 without the file bytes going through the API server. This avoids memory pressure on the backend and removes the API server from the hot path for large uploads.
Based on the project summary and memory search: Conventional commits keep the git log readable and enable au... (simplified)
Conventional commits keep the git log readable and enable automated changelog generation. They also provide structure for the PR template and squash merge strategy.
Based on the project summary and memory search: To fail fast on missing required vars and get typed access t... (simplified)

To fail fast on missing required vars and get typed access to configuration. If a required env var is missing, the app throws a clear error at startup listing what's missing rather than failing mysteriously at runtime.
Based on the project summary and memory search: UUIDs are safe to expose in URLs, work across distributed sy... (simplified)
UUIDs are safe to expose in URLs, work across distributed systems, and don't leak row count. Serial integers expose information about volume and ordering.
Based on the project summary and memory search: iron-session with encrypted cookies. We switched from JWT in... (simplified)

iron-session with encrypted cookies. We switched from JWT in week 4 because JWTs were exposing user data structure to the client. iron-session stores encrypted session data in the arclight_session cookie.
Based on the project summary and memory search: SendGrid. We switched from Resend after the compliance team ... (simplified)
SendGrid. We switched from Resend after the compliance team required a SOC 2 Type 2 certified vendor. The API key env var is SENDGRID_API_KEY.
Based on the project summary and memory search: BullMQ. We replaced the custom setTimeout-based queue with B... (simplified)
BullMQ. We replaced the custom setTimeout-based queue with BullMQ, which runs on our existing Redis instance. Queue definitions are in src/queues/ and worker definitions in src/workers/.
Based on the project summary and memory search: 7 days. iron-session cookies have maxAge set to 7 * 24 * 60 ... (simplified)
7 days. iron-session cookies have maxAge set to 7 * 24 * 60 * 60 (7 days). This matches the refresh token lifetime we had with the previous JWT approach.
Based on the project summary and memory search: SENDGRID_API_KEY. It was previously RESEND_API_KEY when we u... (simplified)
SENDGRID_API_KEY. It was previously RESEND_API_KEY when we used Resend, but was renamed when we migrated to SendGrid.
Based on the project summary and memory search: src/lib/session.ts. This file contains the SessionData inter... (simplified)

src/lib/session.ts. This file contains the SessionData interface (userId, teamId, role), the iron-session config (cookie name arclight_session, httpOnly, secure, sameSite:strict), and the getSession helper.
Based on the project summary and memory search: Using drizzle-kit only: bun drizzle-kit generate to create m... (simplified)

Using drizzle-kit only: bun drizzle-kit generate to create migration SQL from schema.ts, then bun drizzle-kit migrate to apply it. Never make manual DDL changes to the database. Migration files are committed to git.
Based on the project summary and memory search: body-parser (Fastify handles content-type parsing), lodash (... (simplified)
body-parser (Fastify handles content-type parsing), lodash (replaced with native JS), and moment (already replaced by date-fns but still in package.json).
Based on the project summary and memory search: Lint, type-check (tsc --noEmit), run vitest tests, and build... (simplified)
Lint, type-check (tsc --noEmit), run vitest tests, and build. All must pass before merge. Uses bun for package installation. Deploys to staging on merge to main.
Based on the project summary and memory search: Environment variables. Flags are defined as FEATURE_{NAME}=1... (simplified)

Environment variables. Flags are defined as FEATURE_{NAME}=1 to enable, accessed via config.features object. App-specific vars use ARCLIGHT_ prefix. All flags documented in .env.example. No third-party service is used yet.
Based on the project summary and memory search: Files: kebab-case (user-profile.ts). Types/interfaces: Pasca... (simplified)

Files: kebab-case (user-profile.ts). Types/interfaces: PascalCase (UserProfile). Variables/functions: camelCase (getUserProfile). Constants: UPPER_SNAKE_CASE (MAX_RETRY_ATTEMPTS). Database tables: snake_case plural (user_events, team_members). Columns: snake_case (created_at). Env vars: UPPER_SNAKE_CASE; app-specific vars use ARCLIGHT_ prefix.
Based on the project summary and memory search: 80% test coverage target (vitest, v8 provider). PRs must inc... (simplified)

80% test coverage target (vitest, v8 provider). PRs must include tests for any new API endpoint. Max 400-line diff per PR. Conventional commit messages required. No force push to main. Squash merge strategy. PR template with testing checklist.
Based on the project summary and memory search: DOMPurify for user-generated HTML on the frontend. All DB qu... (simplified)

DOMPurify for user-generated HTML on the frontend. All DB queries via Drizzle parameterized builder (no raw SQL interpolation). CSP and other security headers via @fastify/helmet. Dependency vulnerability scanning (npm audit) in CI. Iron-session with encrypted cookies for auth. Stripe webhook signature verification with raw body.
Based on the project summary and memory search: Pino structured logging (JSON in production, pretty in devel... (simplified)

Pino structured logging (JSON in production, pretty in development, level from LOG_LEVEL env). OpenTelemetry tracing via @opentelemetry/sdk-node with Fastify and pg auto-instrumentation, exported to Jaeger locally via OTEL_EXPORTER_OTLP_ENDPOINT. Request IDs propagated in all log entries. Service name: arclight-api via OTEL_SERVICE_NAME.
Based on the project summary and memory search: Client: ioredis, instance in src/lib/redis.ts, connection fr... (simplified)

Client: ioredis, instance in src/lib/redis.ts, connection from REDIS_URL. Key format: arclight:{entity}:{id}. Default TTL: 600 seconds. Cache invalidation: clear keys on write/delete via clearUserCache() helper. BullMQ also uses Redis for background job queues (separate connections, bull:{queueName}: prefix). Rate limiting currently uses in-memory store.
Based on the project summary and memory search: Conventional commits (feat:, fix:, docs:, refactor:, test:, ... (simplified)

Conventional commits (feat:, fix:, docs:, refactor:, test:, chore:). Squash merge to main. No force push to main. Feature branches required. Max 400-line diff per PR. PR template with description and testing checklist. GitHub Actions CI must pass before merge.
Based on the project summary and memory search: Stripe (payments, webhooks, idempotency keys). SendGrid (tra... (simplified)

Stripe (payments, webhooks, idempotency keys). SendGrid (transactional email, via SENDGRID_API_KEY). AWS S3 (file uploads via presigned URLs, bucket from S3_BUCKET env). Redis/ioredis (caching + BullMQ queues). Neon (PostgreSQL serverless driver for request handlers). GitHub Actions (CI/CD). Jaeger (local tracing via OpenTelemetry).
Based on the project summary and memory search: Targets: p50 < 50ms, p99 < 500ms for standard API endpoints.... (simplified)

Targets: p50 < 50ms, p99 < 500ms for standard API endpoints. Write-heavy endpoints (session ingestion) allow p99 < 1000ms. Measurement: k6 load tests at 50 concurrent users for 5 minutes. Baseline stored in docs/performance/baseline.json. Run before major releases and compare against baseline; investigate if p99 regresses more than 20%.
Based on the project summary and memory search: Removal of all JWT code (week 6). The jsonwebtoken package w... (simplified)

Removal of all JWT code (week 6). The jsonwebtoken package was removed, src/lib/auth.ts deleted, and the /api/v1/auth/refresh endpoint removed. iron-session configuration was formalized in src/lib/session.ts with SessionData interface (userId, teamId, role) and cookie name arclight_session.
Based on the project summary and memory search: Synchronous JSON parsing blocking the event loop during anal... (simplified)

Synchronous JSON parsing blocking the event loop during analytics session ingestion (week 4). Diagnosed with clinic.js Flame profiler. Fixed by capping request payload at 500KB and requiring clients to batch — event loop lag dropped back under 5ms.
Based on the project summary and memory search: Database backup automation (week 5, day 36): daily pg_dump t... (simplified)

Database backup automation (week 5, day 36): daily pg_dump to S3 via GitHub Actions scheduled cron workflow (2am UTC), 30-day S3 lifecycle retention, restore procedure documented in docs/runbooks/db-restore.md.
Based on the project summary and memory search: All Error objects must include the operation name in the mes... (simplified)

All Error objects must include the operation name in the message: throw new Error(`${operation}: ${message}`). An AppError class in src/lib/errors.ts adds code and operation fields. Never catch and silently swallow errors — either handle or rethrow.
Based on the project summary and memory search: Keep /api/v1. Only add /api/v2 when there is a genuinely bre... (simplified)

Keep /api/v1. Only add /api/v2 when there is a genuinely breaking change (not just additions). Do not deprecate v1 until v2 has been stable for 3 months. Include an X-API-Version response header in every API response.
Based on the project summary and memory search: Three things: real-time analytics dashboard via WebSockets (... (simplified)

Three things: real-time analytics dashboard via WebSockets (using @fastify/websocket with Redis Pub/Sub for multi-instance state sync), billing v2 with Stripe usage-based meters, and API key authentication for external integrations alongside the existing iron-session auth. Possible addition of read replicas for analytics queries.
Based on the project summary and memory search: Security audit in week 5: added DOMPurify for user-generated... (simplified)

Security audit in week 5: added DOMPurify for user-generated HTML on the frontend, confirmed all DB queries go through Drizzle (no raw SQL interpolation), added CSP and security headers via @fastify/helmet, and added npm audit to GitHub Actions CI for dependency vulnerability scanning.
